prompts:
I'd like you to design and implement a new tool with multiple operations on the tool using the Toolhost pattern (you can read about it at @src/resources/patterns-cookbook-content.ts and i think at @src/resources/server-architecture-content.ts also), which is the approach taken by this server's tools already. \
\
Instead of actual function calls served as tools, this toolhost will serve prompts in the form of operations: that is, we will create a bunch of .ts fies in a new folder in the src/resources/ folder that contain constants as we see in @src/prompts/contents/interleaved-thinking-content.ts --> this content will be served to the agent that's using the server when they call the appropriate operation on this tool, which we will call mental_models. \
\
I propose that we create a tagging system of some kind indicating some basic categories of use case where a particular mental model, or conventional tool used when attempting to apply one like forcing functions,  is useful (i.e. Bayesian reasoning, OODA, etc.). This would help you create a little prompt to serve in the tool description where you would inform the agent what tags exist by dynamically populating the content of the enum we use to define the type.
read the @glassBead-thoughtbox-blog.md to ensure we're3 still aligned with the principles of "infrastructure, not intelligence"\
